text: To examine the effect of the filter upon the outbreak signature we examine the standardized quantity for the filters that we defined previously . We set α = 0 . 03 , which corresponds to a false alarm rate of one per month [ 2 ] . Then , as shown in the Appendix , the threshold , τ k , α , is chosen by solving P ( D k , t > τ k , α ) = α for τ k , α . Either we can estimate this value from the data using the 1 - α quantile of the { D k , t } process of non - outbreak - based training data , or via a normal approximation , given by ( 10 ) . There were some differences between the values of τ k , α for the two methods in the simulations we studied . We chose the normal approximation method as it tended to preserve the specificity across the filters and EDs that we considered .
